meanings.definition: A fund established by the US government to finance the cleanup of hazardous waste sites.
meanings.sent1: The superfund helped clean up the polluted area near the river.
meanings.sent2: The government allocated more money to the superfund for environmental projects.
meanings.sent3: The superfund decided to throw a party to celebrate a successful cleanup.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to environmental causes made her a true superfund of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The superfund's impact on the community was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The money allocated to the superfund for environmental cleanup efforts.
meanings.sent1: The superfund was used to pay for the cleanup of the toxic waste site.
meanings.sent2: The company donated a large sum to the superfund for environmental initiatives.
meanings.sent3: The superfund accidentally fell into the wrong hands, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was a superfund of support for the local environmental group.
meanings.sent5: The superfund's contributions were crucial in preserving the ecosystem.
